embeds.title: Guardian Whirl
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 2 :energy_champ: / Boss / Downfall

Requires 10 **Block** :p_block:.
Deal 4 (6) damage to ALL enemies 4 times.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: Multihit moment
Champ and slime boss absolutely love this card as a finisher
You can play this card for free the turn after you trigger your upgraded ||Ghost Shield||
The block requirement can make it a dead card, though, especially considering it's cost. You won't get that much block from mere defends.
I mean 8 is very close to the requirement
And most characters have a way to block for 10
I'm thinking more of the boss version of the card
While most characters do have that, if you don't draw it and whirl at the same time, it's dead in the hand
This is the boss version
[[ghost shield]]

embeds.title: Hexaguard

messages.content: I see
Since it's ethereal it's basically block that retains for free
So you can let them expire in hand instead of paying the cost?
Card draw must be really good on Hexa, huh
Yep
Back to guardian whirl though: while I can absolutely see it's strengths, I can't see it fitting every build imaginable due to it's cost of 2 and perequisite
most often you'll see this card from tiny bowler hat in which case it costs 0
Cheap block isn't terribly hard to come by but without extra energy a leap equiv. + whirlwind is an entire turn.
Definitely not as some characters really don't care about the card
This is true, yeah.
Like automation
I say that cause auto has immense access to multihits

A very useful way to multiply strength scaling and other such effects, since it hit's 4 times. Particularly notable with goop, vigor, and temporary strength. The aoe is definitely nice, and can be very useful in fights like tri-slavers, gremlin leader, reptomancer, and the act 4 elite. You can find this in shops, but it will cost you a decent chunk (89-109). I think more commonly, you will get this from the effects that give you a random boss card (tiny bowler hat, evil within, study the spire, etc). It's notably awkward in those situations, because you can't use this at all unless you have 10 block, and you won't always be able to provide that.

If you are including this in your deck (from a shop or the boss version of sensory stone), then you really want to make sure you have both ways to amplify the times 4, and pretty consistent ways to block (blur effects, just lots of strong/upgraded block cards generally, block engines from powers, maybe holding onto a block potion). Having 4 energy helps a lot, since this costs 2, you will need to get enough block from a limited amount of energy. The fact that there are plenty of other aoe cards available for most classes that aren't as unreliable is a point against guardian whirl, you will usually be able to find something that is a little less powerful, but doesn't have consistency issues. It can be above replacement for champ decks focusing on vigor stacking, or slime boss decks focusing on goop stacking, since they can't replicate the value of hitting 4 times.

I would be worried about blocking consistently enough to take this in act 1, but by act 2 you are more likely to have 4 energy, dealing with a lot more aoe fights, and have had some chance to set up a block engine or upgrade your block cards, and so it's much more takeable then. The upgrade is a +8 on an aoe card, which is very strong, and crosses the threshold for most of reptomancers daggers (20-25 hp).

Very good with any relic that can help provide the block (boat relics, bolster rod, etc), pen nib, akabeko, necronomicon, and any strength providing relics (vajra, girya, shuriken). Snecko eye can help with the cost, and runic pyramid would make it much easier to hold onto it for when minions are summoned/when you have enough block to enable it.
If you plan on using it J.A.X. can also be helpful.
guardian is sad because this boss card exists but their own version of the card requires _ten more block_

well their own version:
-doesn't exhaust
-costs 1 less
it's not an equal trade at all
Guardian has a much easier time amassing block, too, with their defensive form
not consistently enough for the random turn you draw the card
Yeah but you won't always have it
Guardian doesn't have to pay 100 gold for their version
That's what stasis is for
Next you'll tell me the inferno ghostflame is harder to activate than hexaburn
